summary: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all...
body: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all fine… we even cross lines and have insane discourses and make hateful posts. but my grandparents, mainly my grandfather, is being dragged into a fandom discourse as a “gross man” because @sayruq and @cmollyo want to make a point. can you guys please learn to have boundaries? don’t fucking insult people’s families because they disagree with you, don’t fucking insult people’s families when you don’t know anything about them. it’s the second time people shit on my grandparents. THE SECOND TIME.

reblog.comment: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all fine… we even cross lines and have insane discourses and make hateful posts. but my grandparents, mainly my grandfather, is being dragged into a fandom discourse as a “gross man” because @sayruq and @cmollyo want to make a point. can you guys please learn to have boundaries? don’t fucking insult people’s families because they disagree with you, don’t fucking insult people’s families when you don’t know anything about them. it’s the second time people shit on my grandparents. THE SECOND TIME.

THE SECOND TIME.

summary: arya isn’t just some killer. she doesn’t kill without rhyme or reason. any time she took a life it was because someone was being...
body:
arya isn’t just some killer. she doesn’t kill without rhyme or reason. any time she took a life it was because someone was being immediately threatened or harmed, or this person had done a great wrong to her or someone she knew in the past. she doesn’t simply kill people, and she doesn’t enjoy taking lives. idk how this isn’t a simple fucking concept for some people.

if you think about it, jon snow has killed more people than arya has. i don’t see people calling him a killer, murderer, or murder child. in fact, most of the men in asoiaf have a higher kill count than she does. this is sexism plain and simple.

if you think about it, jon snow has killed more people than arya has. i don’t see people calling him a killer, murderer, or murder child. in fact, most of the men in asoiaf have a higher kill count than she does. this is sexism plain and simple.

summary: Arya Stark: *on her way back to Braavos* You are an attractive, intelligent, confident, successful assassin. He'll take you...
body:
Arya Stark: *on her way back to Braavos* You are an attractive, intelligent, confident, successful assassin. He'll take you back.
Jaqen H'ghar: *on his way to Winterfell* You are an attractive, intelligent, confident, successful assassin. She'll marry you.

blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary:
“i look like an oak tree, with all these stupid acorns” 

 “nice, though. a nice oak tree.” 

 if arya/gendry as a ship had a...
body:
“i look like an oak tree, with all these stupid acorns” 

“nice, though. a nice oak tree.” 

if arya/gendry as a ship had a color it would be green. with the acorn dress, trees, nature, and riverlands associated with them that is their color. its a perfect fit. it represents growth. arya and gendry are just children now but their relationship will grow into something strong like an oak tree. green also represents safety, spring and renewal something i believe the future will hold for both of them. because you can be my forest love and me your forest lass. green is a color of harmony too. arya and gendry’s complementary traits and similar experiences (and hearts) make them a balanced pair.

blog.name: ao3feed-jonrya
blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: To Play The Game
description:
by thewriterthatwaspromised

The long night is almost upon them- still the Game of Thrones wages on. On the brink of two wars in which both results depend on the outcome of each other, Jon Snow struggles with his growing feelings for his “half-sister” Sansa Stark. Unbeknowingly to him, she two struggles with the same feelings. When a secret is finally revealed to the Stark Clan which allows Jon and Sansa to drop all pretense and face the true nature of their relationship, the others arrive- and everything goes to hell.

Words: 2165, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Major Character Death
  • Categories: Multi
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Jon Snow | Aegon Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Bran Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Samwell Tarly, Jamie Lannister, Gilly Craster, Davos Seaworth, Tyrion Lannister, Varys, Brienne Tarth - Character, Missandei
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
  • Additional Tags: jonsa, Jon and Sansa - Freeform, Game of Thrones - Freeform, a song of ice and fire - Freeform, George R R Martin, GRMM

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: Watching Jonsas replace Arya with Sansa in GRRM’s 1993 original outline because D&D replaced Jeyne Poole with Sansa on their...
body:
Watching Jonsas replace Arya with Sansa in GRRM’s 1993 original outline because D&D replaced Jeyne Poole with Sansa on their show in 2015 is one of the most hilarious things I have seen come out of that side of the fandom. Like what even is logic and common sense at this point in the stuff they put out…

I do think the original outline is still important in some respects and GRRM has always maintained that he is still heading towards the same ending he came up with in 1991. If the show had not done Jon/Dany, I would think that Jon/Arya is still possible. There has been foreshadowing for both Jon/Dany and Jon/Arya in the books.

With respect to the books, GRRM continues to emphasize on the Jon-Arya relationship and in the last book, Jon ends up choosing love over duty and dying for her. The Jon-Ramsay feud over Arya in the books is eerily similar to the Jon -Tyrion feud over Arya in the original outline. And while it’s Tyrion who burns down WF in the original outline, in the current books, it’s Ramsay.

We don’t know how the Jon - Dany relationship happens or progresses in both the books or the outline because GRRM has not got there yet or outlined that part. From the show, it seems like they will meet and fall in love as they unite as allies against a common threat. But then how does Arya now fit into this changed ending from his original outline….

GRRM has also been inspired and borrowed heavily from Tad William’s Memory, Sorrow and Thorn (MST) series. Which includes a secret heir growing up as a kitchen boy - Seoman Snowlock (A Jon Snow type) who travels on adventures finding a solution to the undead threat from the North and while doing so falls in love with a princess Marya (an Arya type) who disguises herself as a boy while hiding her identity and can fight and wield a bow. Seoman and Marya end up marrying and getting the Dragonbone chair - while the rightful heir, Josua pretends to die and then goes off to live happily with his family. Marya herself also has a claim to the throne and could also be part Dany, but so too can Josua and his desire for a home and family. There’s also a Tyrion type character in Binabik and other Sam and Bran types in there.

The point being, I think GRRM could still be heading for an Arya/Jon/Dany relationship like Aegon and his sisters or one of these three will die - heroically, sacrificing themselves to defeat the Others. In MST, it’s Marya who kills the Night King equivalent and I can see Arya doing this in ASoIaF. I feel like Arya-Jon’s relationship may end up tragic? Maybe Arya has to stick Jon with the pointy end to kill the NK? Maybe Jon has to kill Dany? I think Arya is totally safe. I am not so sure about Jon and Dany.

I don’t think Arya/Gendry is happening - GRRM has hinted as much. And show Gendry is a mixture of Edric Storm and Gendry at this point.

I don’t think the show will go for a Jon/Dany/Arya - Aegon and his sisters - type thing.  A Jon-Arya relationship would be too controversial for most of the general audience. I think they may stick with Jon/Dany even if GRRM goes that route. Arya also has a lot of ruler/leader foreshadowing in the books like Jon and Dany.

I think Bran is ending up in charge of WF/North as Bran the Builder 2.0. But how Jon, Arya, Dany and Tyrion are going to end the series is still a puzzle to me.

Maybe Arya has to stick Jon with the pointy end to kill the NK? Maybe Jon has to kill Dany? I think Arya is totally safe. I am not so sure about Jon and Dany.

I don’t think Arya/Gendry is happening - GRRM has hinted as much. And show Gendry is a mixture of Edric Storm and Gendry at this point.

I don’t think the show will go for a Jon/Dany/Arya - Aegon and his sisters - type thing.  A Jon-Arya relationship would be too controversial for most of the general audience. I think they may stick with Jon/Dany even if GRRM goes that route. Arya also has a lot of ruler/leader foreshadowing in the books like Jon and Dany.

I think Bran is ending up in charge of WF/North as Bran the Builder 2.0. But how Jon, Arya, Dany and Tyrion are going to end the series is still a puzzle to me.

body:
Where Love Grows

Arya Stark x female Tyrell reader

Reader is a Tyrell cousin in this and lives at Highgarden.

After arriving in High Garden Arya decided that the whole Tyrell family was really too sincere for their own good, well aside from the Lady Olenna. Willas had inquired after Sanaa’s well-being and if he still hoped to wed Arya’s sister he kept it to himself, more than happy to content himself to peppering Arya with questions about Direwolves and their habits. He seemed fascinated and she had noted the affection he lavished on his dogs and the pride he had in his hawks. She had decided that if he did want to marry Sansa it wouldn’t be such a bad thing. Garlan had been equally friendly although less interested in subjects she cared about.

Now, Arya stood scowling in the vast banquet hall at Highgarden. It was too warm in the Reach for the furs and leathers she preferred to wear. Instead she was in a deep green dress that reached her midcalf and dark leggings. She was grateful for that much at least. The dress was relatively plain and it still allowed her freedom of movement albeit less than her own clothes from home would have. She knew that Sansa was right, as a Stark she was the best choice for an ambassador. The pride of the Tyrells would have been insulted had Sansa sent another. But that didn’t mean she had to like it here. She looked down at her cup of wine and took another sip. She was still on her first cup while many of the men in the hall were well into their fourth or fifth. Arya preferred to keep her wits about her. Especially because the pretty girl seated next to her seemed to have made it her mission to make Arya blush as often as possible. Arya was unused to compliments and the sincerity wit which Lady Y/N gave them only made things worse. Arya wished she could blame the compliments on Lady Y/N being drunk but the girl next to Ed had not yet finished her own cup of wine. She seemed to be making a game out of only drinking when Arya did. When the banquet drew to a close and Arya rose from her seat she found Lady Y/N beside her. The other woman leaned in close and whispered meet me in the Rose gardens tomorrow at noon. And then in a sweep of her silken skirts she was gone.

Back in the chambers she had been given Arya lay awake trying to puzzle out what Lady Y/N had meant with her cryptic invitation. Had she just been invited into some political scheme or alliances. Or was this to be a more private meeting? Confused and annoyed Arya fell asleep trying to decide if she should even show up in the Rose garden tomorrow.

Arya stood facing the rose garden several minutes before noon. Her checks flamed red as she began to suspect the invitation was nothing more than an elaborate joke at her expense. She couldn’t help but feel relieved when Lady Y/N finally showed up. Arya noticed the other girl looked quite different her hair held back in a simple braid instead of the ringlets she usually wore. And she wore a plain dress and apron both sprinkled with dirt as well as gardening gloves. Lady Y/N gave a satisfied grin as she studied Arya. “Good you came.” She declared adding “follow me. Arya followed her through the roses until she found herself in the center of what seemed to have been a circle made of rose hedges. Lady Y/N looked rather pleased with herself a satisfied smirk on her face. “This gardens mine”.

“It’s lovely.” Arya replies confused. Had the other girl really asked her here to show her more roses.

Apparently not for Lady Y/N rolled her eyes. “I thought you might want a quiet place to practice your swordplay away from prying eyes. Well maybe not away from my eyes”. She added boldly.

Arya looked at Lady Y/N “So your giving me the use of your garden? Why?”

“Isn’t it apparent to you? I like you that’s why.”

Arya gaped at Lady Y/N. “Lady Y/N why are you doing this?”

“So you’ll call me Y/N of course”. The other girl declared with a winning smile.

“Thank you”. Arya told Y/N.

“Of course I’d appreciate if you avoid killing my roses as much as possible”. Lady Y/N continued in a tone that suggested she was talking about the weather and not giving Arya permission to do something she had sorely missed since her arrival in the Reach.

Looking at Lady Y/N’s smirk Arya couldn’t help but smile herself. “How can I thank you.”

“By being happy here.” Lady Y/N replied without hesitation.

“Does my happiness really matter that much to you?” Arya asked trying to remember the last time someone other than her siblings or Brienne, or maybe Gendry had truly cared about her happiness.

“Yes” Lady Y/N replied placing a hand on Arya’s cheek.

And Arya leaned in and pressed her lips to

Y/N’s

“I’ve been trying to get you to do this since you arrived here” Lady Y/N confesses before leaning in once again to kiss Arya.

“So when you suggested a place away from prying eyes where I could practice my swordplay?”

“My motives weren’t entirely altruistic I admit.”

Arya just smiled and went to kiss Y/N again

title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Stab
body:
Sansa stared at her sister, trying to gauge Arya’s reaction was hard, after all, Arya had gotten so much better at masking her emotions.

In the end, Arya simply sighed and hugged her,  “I’m not saying you should stab Joffrey, but, dude, I mean, you should.”

Sansa rested her head on her sister’s shoulder, “Yeah, I know, he’s awful.”

“You know, I’d always help you hide a body right?”

Sansa snorted, “I know you would and I love you for it.”

“What are sisters for, if not to get rid of terrible men who wrong them?”

summary: I actually like the idea of Arya and Sansa getting along better on season 8. But the implication that if in season 8 we are...
body:
I actually like the idea of Arya and Sansa getting along better on season 8.

But the implication that if in season 8 we are going to see a political debate between Jon and Sansa (which I doubt but whatever) Arya is going to side with her sister is ridiculous and only come from people who don’t like Arya enough - or at least like Sansa much more than Arya and her most important relationship and it shows.

Arya’s first priority has always been Jon and visa versa. Season 7 already showed where Arya’s alliance lies when it comes to her family. Even the implication that Sansa wanted to steal Jon’s crown was enough to make her raged.

So watch her siding with Jon over ANYONE, in season 8.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary:
[Arya and Gendry reunion]
Gendry: When you turned around and looked at me I almost thought you didn’t recognise me.
Arya:...
body:
[Arya and Gendry reunion]

Gendry: When you turned around and looked at me I almost thought you didn’t recognise me.

Arya: Gendry, of course I recognised you.

Gendry: [smiles]

Arya: I would recognise those abs anywhere.

Gendry: What?

Arya: What?

reblog.comment:
[Arya and Gendry reunion]

Gendry: When you turned around and looked at me I almost thought you didn’t recognise me.

Arya: Gendry, of course I recognised you.

Gendry: [smiles]

Arya: I would recognise those abs anywhere.

Gendry: What?

Arya: What?

[Arya and Gendry reunion]

Gendry: When you turned around and looked at me I almost thought you didn’t recognise me.

Arya: Gendry, of course I recognised you.

Gendry: [smiles]

Arya: I would recognise those abs anywhere.

Gendry: What?

Arya: What?
trail.content:
[Arya and Gendry reunion]

Gendry: When you turned around and looked at me I almost thought you didn’t recognise me.

Arya: Gendry, of course I recognised you.

Gendry: [smiles]

Arya: I would recognise those abs anywhere.

Gendry: What?

Arya: What?
